Nerangs.ab: hassārīh ī āb šawišn u-š abastāg pad *war ī āb gōwišn ašemvohū 3 frawarānē čē gāh dārēd aiβiiō vaŋhībiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå tauua ahurāni ahurahe xšnaōϑra u-š wāz frāz gīrišnīh

"He should move in the direction of the water and recite these Avestan texts near the water: Aṣ̌əm Vohū three times; then the Frauuarāne that contains the section of the day (with the dedicatory) aiβiiō vaŋhubiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiā̊ tauua ahurane ahurahe xšnaōϑra. He should take the wāz."

čiyōn ka-š zōhr bē *zōhēnēd ēn abestāg drust bē gōwišn aṣ̌əm vōhū sē frauuarāne čē gāh dārēd aiβiiō vaŋuhēbiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå tauua ahurāne ahurahe xšnaoθra tā sar u-š wāz gīrišnīh

"When he takes (?) the zōhr, he should recite correctly the following abastāg: three aṣ̌əm vōhū and the frauuarāne that includes the gāh (with the šnūman) aiβiiō vaŋuhēbiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå tauua ahurāne ahurahe xšnaoθra until the end. He has to take the wāz."
ParagnaLL8.1.1 Var. a (Pers.) (Mss. K7; om. RJ):

pas nirang farāhim avar gereftan pas zud va rās̱vi dar yazešngāh šodan va ātaš dar ādošk bar afruḫtan va ān kasi ke zud bāšad fanān bastan va rās̱vi dar pas-e sang-e urvis šodan va āb rā pādyāvi kardan va pādyāvi ān ast ke dar barsom čidan gufte budim ke se bār az ān mašrabe-ye bozorg dar mašrabe-ye ḫord rizand va az mašrabe-ye ḫord dar mašrabe-ye bozorg rizand va āb rā nik eḥtiāṭ konand ke pāk bāšad va pas ruy-e sang-e urvis rā sokori se tā va ǧāmdān va him pyāle va māhruy va hāvan va daste va ān āb-e pāk šostan va har yek se bār pas zur bar gereftan ān ast ke sokori-ye farāhimdān va sokori-ye zurdān har do be-dast-e čab bar-dārand va āb-e pāk be-šostan va har yek se bār pādyāb karde be-dast-e rāst bar-dārand va az ruy-e sang-e urwis bālā dārand xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan frauuarāne gāh-e hāvan aiβiiō vaŋhibiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå xšnaōϑra y. v. x. f. yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaōtā OD mraōtū.

"Then the nirang for getting the fraāhim. Afterwards, the zud and the rās̱vi should go to the yazešngāh and kindle the fire on the fire altar. The one who will be the zud should bind the padām and the rās̱vi should go behind the stone of the urvis and has to purify the water. The purification happens as we have written in the section of the barsom čidan so that one pours the water three times from the bigger vessel into the smaller one and from the smaller into the bigger one. They have to take care that the water becomes pure. Then, concerning the stone of the urvis, he should wash the three cups, the ǧāmdān, the him-pyāle, the māhruy, the hāvan, the pestle with pure water, each one three times. Then one should take the zur, that is, one should hold both the cup farāhimdān and the cup zurdān in the left hand and wash them with pure water. When each one has been purifies three times, one holds them with the right hand and raise them from the stone of the urvis. He should recite xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and the frauuarāne with the gāh of hāvan and (the šnūman) aiβiiō vaŋhibiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå xšnaōϑra y. v. x. f. yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaōtā until mraōtū."

nirang-e zur gereftan āb pādyāv kardan va sekure-ye zurdān pādyāv kardan va sar-e †sekāle-ye āb bar dast-e rāst va zurdān bar dast-e čab gereftan xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan frauuarāne gāh āne bid goftan aiβiiō vaŋhibiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiā̊ tauua ahurāne ahurahe xšnaōϑra yas. v. x. f. yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaōtā tā sar

"The instruction for taking the zur. He should purify the water and clean the zurdān-cup. He should take the cup of the water in the right hand and the zurdān in the left. He should recite xšnaōϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and the frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh and (the šnūman) aiβiiō vaŋhibiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå tauua ahurāne ahurahe xšnaōϑra yas. v. x. f. yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaōtā until the end."

ke ǧuddivdād gāh-e oziran †zur bāyad gereftan aivīō vaŋhēbiiō vīspaną̇mca apą̇m mazdaδātaną̇m bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrōapą̇m apasca mazdaδātaiiā̊ tauua ahurāne ahurahe xšnaoϑra ẏ. v. x. f. ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō zaōtā tā sar

"When they perform a Ǧudivdād, they must take the zur at the gāh oziran (and recite corresponding the Frauuarāne with the dedication) aiβiiō vaŋhibiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiå tauua ahurāne ahurahe xšnaōϑra y. v. x. f. (and then) ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō zaōtā until the end."

Quotations.ab: ka zōhr stānēd ā-š pad war ī āb šawišn u-š abastāg pad hassārīh ī āb gōwēd ašəm vohū 3 frawarānē čē gāh dārēd aiβiiō vaŋhubiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiā̊ tauua ahurane ahurahe xšnaōϑra yasnāica tā frasastaiiaēca u-š wāž frāz gīrišnīh

"When he takes the zōhr, he should move in the direction of the water and recite these Avestan texts near the water: Aṣ̌əm Vohū three times; then the Frauuarāne withe corresponding gāh (and with the šnūman) aiβiiō vaŋhubiiō vīspanąmca apąm mazdaδātanąm bərəzatō ahurahe nafəδrō apąm apasca mazdaδātaiiā̊ tauua ahurane ahurahe xšnaōϑra yasnāica until frasastaiiaēca. And he should take the wāz."
